alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Panola; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 11:29AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central DeSoto, west central Marshall, northeastern Tunica, Tate and northeastern Panola Counties through NOON CDT... At 1129 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eudora, or 9 miles west of Hernando, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hernando, Senatobia, Coldwater, Como, Walls, Barr, Lake Cormorant, Phillipp, Strayhorn, Eudora, Independence, Arkabutla, Wakefield, Newport, Trinity, Cockrum, Frees Corners, Aiken, Crossroad and Watson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
